medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with neonatal hypotonia and poor spontaneous movements. After initial improvement, he walked at 13 months, but persistent prominent facial weakness and feeding difficulties remained. Severe dysarthria was noted at 30 months without complaints of fatigue or weakness. By age 5, facial weakness, a constantly open mouth, and a high-arched palate were observed. At age 6, pharyngoplasty was done to improve his speech, and nerve stimulation tests showed low CMAPs from the facial muscles.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of neonatal hypotonia and severe feeding difficulties; mother diagnosed with myasthenia gravis (MG) at age 3.
medical_history.family_history: Mother reported mild bulbar symptoms and fatigue on exertion for the last 4 years; the mother had no further pregnancies.
